ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: broad overview of useful formalism and tools for future work
I developed an understanding of Radiative Transfer, Fluid Instabilities and some mathematical tools that might be helpful in my research among several other topics.
Basics of astrophysical nomenclature & analytical techniques

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: inherently, this course is very disconnected since it is a methods course. That said, by continuing to focus on the stellar application, some general coherence was obtained.

Strengths: Some of the problem sets and exam questions were innovative and fun to work on. Weakness: The course tries to cover a lot of material from different fields in a relatively short period of time. In my opinion this course could be broken down into at least 3 courses covering Fundamentals of Radiative Transfer and Astrophysical Applications, Fluid Dynamics, General Relativity with Applications to different Astrophysical Settings (Black holes, Cosmology) which could then explore each topic in much more detail.
The course is very broad, but I think it could use more depth of coverage

I liked that this class covered a wide variety of material, and I thought the content that was covered was helpful. I think the concept of an introductory, lightning speed course is beneficial in order to review old concepts and get briefly introduced to new ones that we will revisit later. The class did move quite quickly, however, and it would have been nice to maybe cover a few less topics in order to spend more time on the ones that do get covered.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would, I would also recommend trying to follow along in an introductory-style textbook. This helps emphasize the main ideas while not getting bogged down in too many details.
